channel.title: Cheetsheet on Infinity Architect
channel.description: Recent content in Cheetsheet on Infinity Architect

item.title: Primer Cryptography Math
item.description: Glossary domain: set of possible function input. range: set of actual output of function, i.e. <range> := {T(x) for all x in domain} codomain This term is commonly used in 2 context: when you want to emphasize the dimensionality of the output space. e.g. we say T(x) = 0 is an R -> R transformation. We say the codomain is R to emphasize the fact that we are not mapping to a 2D vector space, etc.
